# Task

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".



# Data

clean_column("My Column")

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    # Lowercase the column name and strip leading/trailing whitespaces
    col = strip(lowercase(col))

    # Replace spaces and hyphens with underscores
    col = replace(col, r"[\s-]+" => "_")

    # Return the cleaned column name
    return col
end

# Test the function
@assert clean_column("My Column") == "my_column"
```

This function first strips any leading or trailing whitespaces and lowercases the column name. It then replaces any spaces and hyphens with an underscore to clean the column name. The function is tested with the given example and passes the test.
